title: 2 Ways to Change the Touch Sensitivity & Pointer Speed on Android

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . Tap the gear icon in the Quick Panel by swiping down from the top of your screen. Use this method if you're finding it difficult to tap buttons on your screen.

steps.title: Tap Display or Advanced Features.
steps.content: Tap Display or Advanced Features . Some phones have the touch sensitivity toggle nestled in the Display menu while others have it in Advanced Features, so you may need to check the other menu if you can't find it in one.

steps.title: Tap Touch Sensitivity or Screen Protector Mode.
steps.content: Tap Touch Sensitivity or Screen Protector Mode . Android 13 changes the name of the feature to "Screen Protector Mode," which might be easier to find since screen protectors usually require higher touch sensitivity. The toggle should be blue and pointing right if it's enabled. [1] X Research source If you have this toggle enabled, but your screen response is too slow, force restart your phone , check for a software update , optimize your storage , and remove cases and screen protectors from your phone. [2] X Research source You can also change the touch sensitivity on an iPhone and iPad .

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . The app is usually on the home screen or in the app drawer. You can also open Settings by swiping down from the top of your screen and tapping the gear icon in the Quick Panel. Use this method if you're using a mouse with your smartphone or tablet and need to change how the pointer reacts to the mouse as you use it.

steps.title: Tap General management or System.
steps.content: Tap General management or System . The wording of this general menu changes depending on your Android's model and manufacturer, but you'll find the pointer settings in a menu that allows you to change the system's settings. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Mouse and trackpad.
steps.content: Tap Mouse and trackpad . A new menu will appear with settings so you can change your mouse's pointer and scrolling speed. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Drag the sliders to adjust how your pointer behaves.
steps.content: Drag the sliders to adjust how your pointer behaves. Drag the sliders to the right if you want the pointer speed or the scrolling speed to be faster or drag them to the left to slow these speeds down. [5] X Research source There are more settings so you can change what your mouse buttons do. Enable "Enhance pointer precision" to make your pointer move faster and slower according to your mouse.
